info.title: SuperOffice REST API v1
info.termsOfService: You must be an authorized user to access this API.

get.summary: Set default values into a new TicketMessageEntity.
get.description:
NetServer calculates default values on the entity, which is required when creating/storing a new instance Calls the Ticket agent service CreateDefaultTicketMessageEntity.
NsApiSlow threshold: 2000 ms.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Convert string references and multi-language values into a specified language (iso2) code.

parameters.name: SO-Language
parameters.description: Convert string references and multi-language values into a specified language (iso2) code. Overrides Accept-Language value.

parameters.name: SO-Culture
parameters.description: Number, date formatting in a specified culture (iso2 language) code. Partially overrides SO-Language/Accept-Language value. Ignored if no Language set.

parameters.name: SO-TimeZone
parameters.description: Specify the timezone code that you would like date/time responses converted to.

parameters.name: SO-AppToken
parameters.description: The application token that identifies the partner app. Used when calling Online WebAPI from a server.

get.description:
Can be sorted and further filtered using OData conventions:

* TicketMessage?$select=col1,col2,abc/col3
* TicketMessage?$filter=col1 eq 'foo' and startswith(col2, 'baz')
* TicketMessage?$orderby=abc/col3,col1
* TicketMessage?$top=1000
* TicketMessage?$mode=full


OData returns XML or JSON carriers depending on the Accept headers.


Calls the Archive service using the "TicketMessage" archive.


## Filter Operators: ##

ints: eq =, ne, le, lt, gt, ge, set, equals, greater, less, unequals, between

strings: contains, is, notBegins, notContains, isNot

associate: associateIsOneOf, associateIsNotOneOf,  

list ids: oneOf, NotOneOf, 

dates: before, date, after, dateBetween, beforeToday

Unary ops: currentAssociate, beforeToday, today, afterToday, lastWeek, thisWeek, nextWeek, lastMonth, thisMonth, nextMonth, lastQuarter, thisQuarter, nextQuarter, thisHalf, thisYear

Funcs: substringof(a,b), startswith(a,b), endswith(a,b), this(f,period), next(f,n,period), previous(f,n,period), thisAndNext(f,n,period), thisAndPrevious(f,n,period), thisAndPreviousAndNext(f,period)

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Comma separated list of column names to return. "nameDepartment,fullname,category". Can also use aggregation functions and modifiers: "Count(category):Footer"

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Expression to restrict the results. e.g.: "name begins 'foo' and category gt 1"

parameters.name: $orderBy
parameters.description: Comma separated list of column names to sort by, with optional direction. "name asc,fullname,category desc"

parameters.name: $entities
parameters.description: Comma separated list of entity names to use. Default = "". "contact, person"

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Number of rows to return in results

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Number of rows from database to skip before returning results

parameters.name: $mode
parameters.description: FULL (with raw values and hints for each value) or SLIM (just the display values)

parameters.name: $options
parameters.description: Provider specific options. e.g: "GrandTotal=true"

parameters.name: $context
parameters.description: Provider specific context parameter.

parameters.name: $format
parameters.description: Set XML or JSON output format; override the format determined from Accept header.

parameters.name: $jsonSafe
parameters.description: Make output names into JSON safe property names. Replace all unsafe characters with _ underscore.

parameters.name: $output
parameters.description: Return Logical or Display values in SLIM mode. Logical returns true/false for booleans, Display returns icon hints. Dates are always returned as ISO strings.

get.summary: Get a ticket message entity with posibillity to change embedded images to be represented with inline data within the HTML body.
get.description: If using inline data, be sure not to save this back to the database.

parameters.description: The id of the ticket message entity

parameters.name: embedImages
parameters.description: If set to Inline, then use inline base64 data to represent the images in the HTML body. Default: Link will use link to the image.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.TicketMessageEn.description:
The ticket messages are e-mails, SMS or other messages attached to a ticket (aka request).
<para />
Carrier object for TicketMessageEntity.
Services for the TicketMessageEntity Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.ITicketAgent">Ticket Agent</see>.

CreatedBy.description: The associate who created this ticket message

Author.description: A string representing the author of the message. Could be a user&apos;s name, or a persons email address.

MessageId.description: The Message-Id header value from the email. Used for threading, i.e. connecting messages to existing tickets.

TimeSpent.description: The time spent (minutes) for this message.

HtmlBody.description: The html body for the message (if any).

EmailHeader.description: The email header is saved in this field as raw text

DebugInfo.description: The debug info for the message.

MailSorter.description: The name of the mail sorter used when the email was imported. Note: We must use name instead of id since the id&apos;s change every time one changes the mail sorter. :-0

MessageCategory.description: Defines what kind of message this is.

Person.description:
If this is an incoming message, this will contain the person 
<para>Use MDO List name "person_new" to get list items.</para>

SearchTitle.description: A copy of the title of the ticket, for search optimisation and simpler reporting.

MessageHeaders.description: Contains the message headers, like To, Cc, Bcc information, or custom headers

Important.description: If this message is important or not.

Language.description: The language this message is in, based on some kind of analysis

Sentiment.description: Sentiment index, 100 = completely happy; -100 = suicidally unhappy; 0 = no idea

SentimentConfidence.description: Confidence of sentiment index, 0 = no idea, 100 = completely sure

Badge.description: Badge to explicitly determine how a message was generated

ExtraFields.description:
Deprecated: Use {SuperOffice.CRM.Services.TicketMessageEntity.CustomFields} instead.
Extra fields added to the carrier. This could be data from Plug-ins, the foreign key system, external applications, etc.

CustomFields.description:
Udef + Extra fields added to the carrier. Extra fields as defined by changes to database schema + user-defined fields as defined by admin.
Custom fields combines user defined fields and extra fields into one bucket. 
The individual {SuperOffice.CRM.Services.TicketMessageEntity.ExtraFields} and <see cref="!:UserDefinedFields">UserDefinedFields</see> properties are deprecated in favor of this
combined collection.

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.Ticket.description:
The ticket carrier is used for representing a service request.
<para />
Carrier object for Ticket.
Services for the Ticket Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.ITicketAgent">Ticket Agent</see>.

LastChanged.description: The last time the ticket was modified.

ReadByOwner.description: The datetime for when the ticket last was read by the owner.

ReadByCustomer.description: The datetime for when the ticket was read by the customer.

FirstReadByUser.description: The datetime for when the ticket first was read by a user.

Activate.description: When the ticket should be activated, if it is postponed.

RepliedAt.description: The datetime for when the ticket was replied to. I.e. the first external message added to the ticket.

AlertTimeout.description: The datetime for when the ticket should jump to the next alert_level.

CreatedBy.description: The id of the user who created the ticket. 1 (system user) if the ticket was created externally

CreatedByName.description: Initials, also login name, possibly database user name

Author.description: A string representing the author of the ticket (same as author of first message).

OwnedBy.description: The id of the user who owns the ticket. 1 (system user) if the ticket is unassigned.

OwnedByName.description: Initials, also login name, possibly database user name

Category.description: The id of the category a ticket is in.

CategoryName.description: The (short) name of this category. E.g. &apos;support&apos;.

CategoryFullname.description: The fullname (compiled from parents&apos; names) for this category. E.g. &apos;norway/product A/support&apos;.

Priority.description: The reference to the ticket_priority table.

BaseStatus.description: The status of the ticket. I.e. active/closed/postponed/deleted

TicketStatusDisplayValue.description: Get the display name of the ticket status.

Origin.description: What is the origin of this ticket

CustId.description: The reference to the customer. NULL or -1 if ticket is not connected to customer.

PersonFullname.description: Get the full name for the primary person (customer)

AlertLevel.description: The alert level for the ticket. Matches the level value of the ticket_alert table.

ConnectId.description: If a ticket is connected to another ticket, this field is set to the id of the &apos;master&apos; ticket.

ReadStatus.description: Whether the owner has read the ticket or not (red, yellow, green).

TimeToReply.description: The time (minutes) between when the ticket was created and when it was replied to. Calculated based on priority&apos;s timeframe.

RealTimeToReply.description: Same as time_to_reply, but not calculated based on priority.

TimeToClose.description: The time (minutes) between when the ticket was created and when it was closed. Calculated based on priority&apos;s timeframe.

RealTimeToClose.description: Same as time_to_close, but not calculated based on priority.

TimeSpentInternally.description: The total time (seconds) within the priority's office hours the ticket has been in an open status (configurable), not including current state

TimeSpentExternally.description: The total time (seconds) within the priority's office hours the ticket has been in a external waiting status (configurable), not including current state

TimeSpentQueue.description: The total time (seconds) within the priority's office hours the ticket has been in a queue status, not including current state

RealTimeSpentInternally.description: The total time (seconds) within 24x7 the ticket has been in an open status (configurable), not including current state

RealTimeSpentExternally.description: The total time (seconds) within 24x7 the ticket has been in a external waiting status (configurable), not including current state

RealTimeSpentQueue.description: The total time (seconds) within 24x7 hours the ticket has been in a queue status, not including current state

TimeSpent.description: The total time (minutes). Aggregated time spent from ticket&apos;s messages. Read-only for external use.

HasAttachment.description: Boolean indicating if this ticket has one or more attachments.

NumReplies.description: The number of replies (messages) to the customer for this request.

NumMessages.description: The total number of messages for this request.

FromAddress.description: The from-address used when this ticket got created, e.g. by email

ContactId.description: The company of the person in the cust_id field, if that person belongs to a company

ContactName.description: The name of the connected contact

OwnedByAssociateId.description: The associate id of the owner of the ticket.

Language.description: The language of the first external message

Sentiment.description: The sentiment index of the last external message

SentimentConfidence.description: The sentiment confidence of the last external message

SaleHeading.description: The heading of the connected sale

ProjectName.description: The name of the connected project

FormSubmissionId.description: If this ticket was created from a form submission, this field will point to that record

TicketTypeId.description: The id of the Request Type

TicketTypeName.description: The name of the Request Type

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.CRM.Security.TableRight.description:
Wraps a table right together with an explanatory reason.
Code can indicate why access is restricted.

SuperOffice.CRM.Security.FieldProperty.description: Class holding properties like field length, field type about a field in the carrier.

SuperOffice.CRM.Security.FieldRight.description:
Wraps the field right together with an explanatory reason.
Also adds logical operators to the field rights so that they can be easily combined.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.Associate.description:
Carrier object for Associate.
Services for the Associate Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IAssociateAgent">Associate Agent</see>.

Name.description: Initials, also login name, possibly database user name

PersonId.description:
Owning person record 
<para>Use MDO List name "person" to get list items.</para>

Type.description: User type - 1 = internal user, 2 = resource, 3 = external user, 4 = anonymous, 5 = system

GroupIdx.description: Primary group membership, see UserGroupLink for secondary memberships

FullName.description: The associate's culture formatted fullname (firstname, middleName and lastname)

FormalName.description: The associate's culture formatted formalname (firstname, middleName and lastname, title, mrmrs)

Deleted.description: If true, the user is retired and should have no rights, not appear in lists, etc.

EjUserId.description: ID of the ej user record corresponding to this associate; 0 for associates that are not ej users

ExtraFields.description:
Deprecated: Use {SuperOffice.CRM.Services.Associate.CustomFields} instead.
Extra fields added to the carrier. This could be data from Plug-ins, the foreign key system, external applications, etc.

CustomFields.description:
Udef + Extra fields added to the carrier. Extra fields as defined by changes to database schema + user-defined fields as defined by admin.
Custom fields combines user defined fields and extra fields into one bucket. 
The individual {SuperOffice.CRM.Services.Associate.ExtraFields} and <see cref="!:UserDefinedFields">UserDefinedFields</see> properties are deprecated in favor of this
combined collection.

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.Person.description:
Carrier object for Person.
Services for the Person Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IPersonAgent">Person Agent</see>.

Position.description: The position. This is a predefined SuperOffice value, different from Title

FullName.description: Get the persons full name (internal name used in clients for employees).

DirectPhone.description: Returns the direct phone that belong to the contact person.

FormalName.description: Get formal name for a person, as used in labels. (Full name + person title + academic title)

Retired.description: 1 = the user is retired and should have no rights, not appear in lists, etc.

Rank.description: Display sort sequence for default sort order

ActiveInterests.description: Number of records in pintr table; select count(*) from pintr pi where pi.person_id = this.person_id == activeInterests is always true

FaxPhone.description: Returns the fax phone that belong to the contact person.

MobilePhone.description: Returns the mobile phone that belong to the contact person.

ContactPhone.description: Returns the direct phone that belong to the persons contact.

AssociateId.description: Id of the item's owner (Associate id)

UsePersonAddress.description: If 1, use person's address for mailing instead of company address

ContactFax.description: Actual phone number as eneterd by the user

Kanafname.description: Kana first name, used in Japanese versions only

Kanalname.description: Kana last name, used in Japanese versions only

Post1.description: Postal address, used in Japanese versions only

Post2.description: Postal address, used in Japanese versions only

Post3.description: Postal address, used in Japanese versions only

ActiveErpLinks.description: How many active ERP links are there for this person?

SupportAssociateId.description: Our support contact for this person

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.TicketMessageHe.description:
Contains information about a header connected to a ticket message
<para />
Carrier object for TicketMessageHeader.

Name.description: The name of the header. This can for example be To, Cc or other custom headers that is set up in Service

Value.description: The value of the header. Can for example be an email address, or a custom header extracted from emails

StdItem.description: If this has a value, it indicates that a standard header text from the language database should be used - and witch one to use

StdItemCol.description: If this is 1, concatenate the standard item text with header name field, if 2 use header value field instead. If this col is 0, use the empty field - preferably the value column.

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.AttachmentEntit.description:
The Attachment carrier represent meta data for a Service attachment
<para />
Carrier object for AttachmentEntity.
Services for the AttachmentEntity Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.ITicketAgent">Ticket Agent</see>.

ContentType.description: The content type for the attachment (e.g. &apos;applaction/octet-stream&apos; or &apos;application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.wordprocessingml.document&apos;).

AttSize.description: The size (in bytes) for the attachment.

InlineImage.description: True if this attachment is inlined in the html_body.

ContentId.description: The content_id of this attachment, used for inline images

AuthKey.description: The key used for authenticating access to this attachment.

IsSafeFileExtension.description: Is file considered to be safe (based on extension and settings)

FieldProperties.description: Field property dictionary mapping field names to field access rights.

SuperOffice.Services.WebApi.OData.ODataS.description: Easy to use archive results - just a flat list of values.

SuperOffice.CRM.Services.FieldInfoBase.description:
Abstract basic information about database fields. May be custom or user-defined fields. The information can be used to build a user interface.
<para />
Carrier object for FieldInfoBase.
Services for the FieldInfoBase Carrier is available from the <see cref="T:SuperOffice.CRM.Services.IUserDefinedFieldInfoAgent">UserDefinedFieldInfo Agent</see>.

FieldType.description: What sort of data does this field contain. 1 = int, 2 = short text, ...

DisplayName.description: Label for field. May be multi-lang string encoded.

Description.description: Optional tooltip text for this field

ShortLabel.description: Short name to be used in Archive headings and on page 1. If blank, the fieldLabel will be used everywhere.

HideField.description: Hide the field from the UI. Only allow API access.

IsIndexed.description: Is this field indexed? 0 if no, index no. if yes

IsMandatory.description: 0 = no, 1 = yes (field must be filled out)

IsExternal.description: Should this field be shown to external users via customer center?

IsDisplayField.description: Flag indicating that this field is chosen as DisplayField for a table it belongs

Rank.description: Tab order, ranking within the custom fields.

TemplateVariableName.description: Template variable name: 'cs01', 'cl02' etc. Null for extra fields.

SuperOffice Password.description:
SuperOffice username:password are passed in Base64-encoded. 

You can also pass inn an unencoded ticket 7T:abc== with the HTTP Authenticate header.

SuperId Authentication.description:
SuperOffice SuperId OAuth implicit flow. 
You need to issue a request to the SuperId authorization URL
    https://online.superoffice.com/login/common/oauth/authorize?response_type=token
      &client_id=670734e0-4c5a-11e3-be9e-a171392e81db
      &redirect_uri=https://example.com/spa/

passing in the application id and redirect URL.

SuperId will log the user in, and redirect to the requested redirect URL with a #payload
containing the access token and claims. (The redirect URL must be registered with SuperId in advance)

   https://example.com/spa#access_token=8A%3aCust12227.AXRrCITpPBvQX3UbIohb
      &token_type=bearer
      &state=
      &expires_in=3600
      &ctx=Cust12227
      &netserver_url=https%3a%2f%2fsod.superoffice.com%2fCust12227%2fRemote%2fServices82%2f

You can take the #access_token value and pass it as the Authenticate HTTP header as a BEARER token.
